meanings.definition: To put or lay in an unremembered place; lose.
meanings.sent1: I often mislay my keys and spend hours searching for them.
meanings.sent2: She mislays her glasses almost every morning and has to ask for help finding them.
meanings.sent3: After a long day, I mislay my phone in the fridge, thinking it's the remote control.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumble of thoughts, causing her to mislay important documents in the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The mislaid treasure map led the adventurers on a wild goose chase through the forest.

meanings.sent1: If you mislay your homework, you can ask the teacher for an extension.
meanings.sent2: He tends to mislay his wallet when he's in a rush to leave the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy would mislay his toys in the most unexpected places.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to mislay its grip on reality as the clock struck midnight.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to mislay a coin in one hand and make it appear in the other.
